description: Use this basic scone dough for any sweet scone variety.
ingredients: [{"name": "all-purpose flour", "units": "cups", "amount": 2}, {"name": "granulated sugar", "units": "cups", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "salt", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "baking powder", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": 2.5}, {"name": "unsalted butter", "units": "cups", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "heavy cream or buttermilk", "units": "cups", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "large egg", "units": null, "amount": 1}, {"name": "pure vanilla extract", "units": "teaspoons", "amount": 1.5}, {"name": "add-ins (chocolate chips, berries, nuts, fruit, etc)", "units": "cups", "amount": "1-1.5"}, {"name": "coarse sugar for topping", "units": null, "amount": null}]
instructions: Whisk flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder together in a large bowl. Grate the frozen butter using a box grater. Add it to the flour mixture and combine with a pastry cutter, two forks, or your fingers until the mixture comes together in pea-sized crumbs. Whisk heavy cream, the egg, and vanilla extract together in a small bowl. Drizzle over the flour mixture, add the add-ins, then mix together until everything appears moistened. Pour onto the counter and, with floured hands, work dough into a ball. Press into an 8-inch disc and cut into 8 wedges. Brush scones with remaining heavy cream and sprinkle with coarse sugar. Refrigerate for at least 15 minutes. Preheat oven to 400°F (204°C). Bake for 18-26 minutes or until golden brown around the edges.
notes: For savory scones, reduce sugar to 2 Tablespoons and omit vanilla. You can freeze scone dough before or after baking.
